channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Donald Trump says he has seen evidence that the coronavirus started in Wuhan virology laboratory
item.description: President Donald Trump made the explosive charge that the coronavirus that has caused millions of infections may have been created in a Chinese lab in Wuhan and spoke of ways to punish the nation.

item.title: Wildlife worker dubbed Tiger King of Instagram is filmed punching a lion cub
item.description: Dean Schneider, 27, who quit his job as a financier in Switzerland to look after a pride of lions at a wildlife sanctuary in South Africa, uploaded a clip of himself striking a cub after it scratched his shoulder.

item.title: Ministers warn lockdown could stay for MONTHS until new cases drop to the hundreds
item.description: Ministers have warned lockdown may need to remain for months until the number of new cases falls below 1,000 per day after Professor Chris Whitty said a second peak could be worse than the first.

item.title: Royal fans share their sadness at the breakdown in William and Harry's relationship
item.description: The DIY SOS special from 2015 showed Princes William and Harry working together to renovate derelict streets in Manchester to build homes for ex-service personnel.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... the Mail Force PPE airlift
item.description: PAUL THOMAS on... the Mail Force PPE airlift

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson says we're 'past virus peak'
item.description: Having chaired Cabinet this morning, Boris Johnson said he 'understands the impatience' of people to end the draconian restrictions crippling the economy.

item.title: Shot of a jackal chasing a magpie is among entries in prestigious German photography contest
item.description: A stunning photo of a golden jackal chasing a magpie is just one of the incredible entries in this year's Glanzlichter Nature Photo Contest which was open to all nature photographers.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson 'sounds breathless' for briefing
item.description: Boris Johnson raised fears for his health tonight with a breathless first Downing Street briefing since being discharged from intensive care after battling coronavirus.

item.title: Steel memorial to Alan Turing 'threatens the existing character' of King's College landscape
item.description: The 12ft steel structure, designed by Sir Antony Gormley, will commemorate the Second World War code-breaker, who attended King's College in Cambridge between 1931 and 1934.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson joins clap for carers after illness
item.description: The Prime Minister stood on the steps of Downing Street to salute the NHS just hours after hosting his first daily press conference since recovering from the virus.

item.title: Make your own takeaways! These dishes will save you money and are better for your waistline too
item.description: To continue our exclusive WW series to help you navigate the challenges of the coronavirus lockdown without piling on the pounds - we're sharing brilliant takeaway-alternative recipes.

item.title: Healthy 12-year-old girl's heart stopped after she developed rare heart condition linked to COVID-19
item.description: Juliet Daly almost died when the coronavirus seemed to trigger a rare heart condition, causing her heart to stop and her to be put on a ventilator for four days.

item.title: Couple build their unborn baby a mini CELLAR DOOR in the vineyards as a DIY project
item.description: An Australian winemaking couple have built their unborn child a miniature cellar door in the vineyards while in isolation, complete with a fridge, groceries and espresso machine.

item.title: Fix potholes while roads are empty, councils are told as breakdowns caused by them soar
item.description: The Department of Transport has instructed local councils in England and Wales to fix damaged roads as RAC research indicates that 3,426 cars were damaged by potholes this year to March.

item.title: Hard times for Durex as condom sales plunge amid coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Laxman Narasimhan, chief executive of Reckitt Benckiser, the maker of Durex condoms, said sales of condoms had been hit particularly hard in UK and Italy.

item.title: Paul Breeze retired military policeman on Ross Kemp Milton Keynes coronavirus documentary dies
item.description: Paul Breeze asked Ross Kemp to feature him on his documentary about how the NHS is fighting the virus on the frontline at Milton Keynes Hospital.

item.title: JAN MOIR: If Boris Johnson's life was a TV drama, none of us would believe it
item.description: JAN MOIR: Wilfred, Winston, Oliver, Pericles, Diggory, Kevin, Josh? Whatever they decide to call him, what kind of a world will Boris's baby son inherit?

item.title: Conor McGregor delivers vital supplies to children's hospital in Dublin amid COVID-19 crisis
item.description: Conor McGregor personally delivered supplies to a Dublin children's hospital on Thursday amid the COVID-19 crisis.

item.title: Football matches could be played behind closed doors 'ALL of next season'
item.description: There are fears there will be no spectators allowed into any major sporting events up until Christmas owing to the current coronavirus crisis, but this could continue until May according to the Times.

item.title: 13 dementia patients saved from coronavirus by hero nurse who worked through swine flu crisis
item.description: Maria Spollin, a hero nurse who worked during the 2009 swine flu virus, has helped save 13 dementia patients from coronavirus at the Church Farm at Skylarks in West Bridgford, Nottingham.

item.title: Army life was the perfect fit for Prince Harry, says Richard Kay
item.description: RICHARD KAY: Yesterday it was reported that Prince Harry (pictured at Westminster Abbey) misses the Army, the camaraderie that comes with a life in uniform and the bonds of war.

item.title: Madonna, 61, claims that she has coronavirus antibodies after getting tested
item.description: The 61-year-old pop legend made the revelation in an Instagram video on Thursday, which is part of a series she's dubbed her "Quarantine Diaries."

item.title: Diane Abbott and Bell Ribeiro-Addy disciplined by Sir Keir Starmer over Zoom call anti-semitism
item.description: Diane Abbott dialled in to the call on Zoom alongside people including Jackie Walker, who was thrown out of the Labour Party for gross misconduct after she said Jews financed the slave trade.

item.title: Canadian couple who were traveling the world in their van take rescue flight home amid pandemic
item.description: Eamon Fitzgerald, 28, and Rebecca 'Bec' Moroney, 29, were living out of their van in Morocco with their friend Lee MacMillan, 27, at the start of the health crisis.

item.title: Robot gorilla 'spy' captures the first footage of Silverbacks in Uganda singing for their supper
item.description: Filmmakers created a life-like robot baby gorilla to spy on a group of Silverbacks in the jungle of Uganda. It captured the first footage of the wild creatures singing for their supper.

item.title: NASA chooses SpaceX, Blue Origin and Dynetics to design human landing systems for Artemis mission
item.description: NASA 's Artemis mission has turned into a space race between billionaires, as Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin and Elon Musk's SpaceX have been chosen to develop human landing systems for mission.

item.title: Prince Andrew's friend Ghislaine Maxwell 'made Princess Diana cry'
item.description: Maxwell, 58, who is accused of procuring underage girls for paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, is said to have found it 'really funny' to tease Princess Diana.

item.title: Residents of a remote island in Belize will use a machine to harvest drinking water from the air
item.description: Residents on a small island off the coast of Belize have begun harvesting fresh drinking water from the air after shipments from the mainland were delayed due to COVID-19.

item.title: Professor answers question about why jeans can't stop a fart, but a mask can prevent coronavirus
item.description: It started as a joke, but the question 'if a fart can make it through jeans, how can a cloth mask save you from COVID' is answered by a professor who says an N95 mask is made to stop larger particles.

item.title: Gigi Hadid CONFIRMS she is expecting first child with boyfriend Zayn Malik
item.description: The model, 25, was appearing on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon when she confirmed she was expecting her first child with boyfriend Zayn Malik.

item.title: EastEnders in 'talks over how to deal with coronavirus filming issues when production recommences'
item.description: EastEnders bosses have reportedly held crisis talks about how they'll tackle coronavirus filming issues when production on the BBC soap recommences in June.

item.title: Oxford scientists working on coronavirus vaccine will know in six weeks if it's likely to work
item.description: Sir John Bell, Regius professor of medicine at Oxford University, said 'several hundred' people have now been given the jab in the first British trial to find a vaccine.

item.title: ABBA triumph over Oasis and One Direction on list of the bands that fans most want to see reunited
item.description: Swedish pop group Abba (pictured) are the band fans most want to see reunited and playing live again after they split in 1982 following their rise to worldwide fame in 1974.

item.title: Priti Patel hopes coronavirus crisis will BOOST police recruitment drive
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel, pictured giving the government's daily coronavirus briefing at Downing Street on Saturday, has said that the coronavirus crisis could help boost police numbers.

item.title: Study casts doubt over hydroxychloroquine's potential for treating coronavirus
item.description: A Harvard University review found issues with each of 10 studies on hydroxychloroquine they examined. The drug can be immunosuppressive, which could be helpful or harmful for covid patients.

item.title: I never thought I'd say this... but I'm so thrilled that my boomerang baby is moving back home
item.description: TOM UTLEY: On the day this week when Boris Johnson and Carrie Symonds were celebrating their happy event, my wife and I received joyful news about our own baby boy.

item.title: Benidorm holiday prices are being searched for the most
item.description: In a table of the top 20 most popular package holiday searches made in April, the Maldives is in the No2 slot, followed by Las Vegas, Tenerife, Orlando and New York in sixth place.

item.title: More than HALF of key workers earn below the national average including critical care workers
item.description: Glassdoor, one of the world's largest job and recruiting sites, have revealed how key workers critical to the coronavirus frontline are paid salaries below the UK national average.

item.title: Mowing your lawn just once a month could attract 10 times as many bees
item.description: Mowing your lawn just once a month could attract 10 times as many bees by boosting flowers like daisies and white clover, according to UK wildlife charity Plantlife.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: BBC's Sir Humphrey Burton lays bare the secrets of biggest names in memoir
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Sir Humphrey Burton is to spill the beans in a memoir, including anecdotes about acquaintances like Andrew Lloyd Webber and Leonard Bernstein.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: When will TV news stop scaring us to death over coronavirus crisis?
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Back in 2004, in the run-up to the U.S. Presidential election, I was invited to take part in a special edition of the BBC's Question Time, live from Miami.

item.title: 'I cannot just talk about him right now': Donald Trump deepens mystery over Kim Jong Un's condition
item.description: President Donald Trump on Thursday continued his series of cryptic comments on the health and well-being of North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un.

item.title: Do you know your pino fridgio from your doughverkill? Bone up on the latest lockdown lingo
item.description: The English language is constantly forced to adapt. Even in crisis, new words are born. Do you enjoy a quarantini at locktail hour? If you don't know these terms, you aren't aware of Lockdown Lingo.

item.title: Coronavirus eradication is 'technically impossible' and second wave this winter could be MORE severe
item.description: Professor Chris Whitty told an online lecture: 'It's not just in Game Of Thrones that winter is always coming ... the winter is always worse than summer, spring and autumn for health.'

item.title: Now we can care safely
item.description: They have been called the forgotten front in the war against Covid-19. Diligent, devoted but under-equipped, they are the staff of Britain's embattled care homes.

item.title: Plant extracts could hold the key to curing headaches and nausea from drinking too much alcohol
item.description: Experts from Germany found that people who drank certain soluble plant extracts and minerals after alcohol had fewer symptoms than those who just consumed the minerals.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES: Boris Johnson and the Boffins were back - and the trio had some new material!
item.description: Back at last in their favorite Downing Street rehearsal room, the Prime Minister (pictured), gave the government's daily coronavirus briefing with his scientific and medical advisers.

item.title: Boris Johnson says Britons SHOULD wear face masks after lockdown
item.description: Boris Johnson today announced that wearing face masks will be part of the UK's coronavirus lockdown exit strategy.

item.title: Gilead can make enough remdesivir to treat 'several million' next year
item.description: Gilead Sciences said Thursday in an earnings report that it is ramping up production of its antiviral remdesivir, and could make 'several million' 10-day treatment courses of the drug for 2021.

item.title: Kate Garraway says husband Derek is 'still with us' but is facing a 'battle' with coronavirus
item.description: Kate Garraway has given fans an update on her husband Derek's condition as he continues to battle coronavirus.

item.title: Protected Spanish dunes blighted by tourists and nudists return to 'pristine' condition
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The undulating Maspalomas sand dunes in Gran Canaria (pictured) have undergone a miraculous transformation which has left environmentalists stunned but delighted.

item.title: Hairstylist reveals gross build-up caused by silicones and parabens
item.description: Sydney Augusta, from Seattle, Washington, shared the video on TikTok, and in it she is seen using hairdresser scissors to scrape a layer of build-up from a section of her hair.

item.title: Parents share funny, exhausting realities of being stuck home with kids all day during quarantine
item.description: Many parents are home with their kids all day for the very first time. They've been sharing their experiences online, from the funny to the exhausting to the mildly infuriating.

item.title: Virus checks and wearing face masks on a plane could be future of air travel says JOHN HOLLAND-KAYE
item.description: JOHN HOLLAND-KAYE: Prior to the outbreak of Covid-19, the term 'unprecedented' was as rare as its meaning, only uttered for the sake of hyperbole if at all. Now this phrase is commonplace.

item.title: Judge spares thug, 18, who terrorised a neighbourhood for five months in defiance of 100 victims
item.description: Judge Judge Anthony Cross (pictured) at Manchester Crown Court has given a thug a second chance by after he terrorised neighbours to the point where they asked him to be evicted.

item.title: Carrie Symonds claps for NHS just a day after giving birth to Boris Johnson's baby boy
item.description: Carrie Symonds had another reason to thank the NHS this week as she took part in the weekly clap for health care workers. She gave birth to a baby boy yesterday morning.

item.title: Rarely seen footage shows joyous scenes across Britain on the day Hitler
item.description: The programme VE Day In Colour: Britain's Biggest Party, which will be screened at 8pm on Sunday, shows rare footage of people celebrating VE Day around the world.
item.media:credit: Channel 4/VE Day in Colour: Britain's Biggest Party

item.title: Simon Cowell 'is granted permission to revamp his £15m London mansion'
item.description: The music mogul, 60, is said to have been given the go-ahead from the council to transform his seven-bedroom property into a home that meets the 'modern requirements of the family'.

item.title: New heads for old tales: Alan Bennett's Talking Heads monologues are coming back with A-list stars
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Net curtains. They're respectable enough when they hang straight, especially when made from lace, not nylon.

item.title: Ralph Rucci says door is now 'wide open' to criticize Anna Wintour after André Leon Talley's attack
item.description: Rucci took to Instagram Sunday to praise Talley for speaking out against Wintour in his new memoir, before unleashing his own tirade against the iconic Vogue editor.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump criticises Sweden for avoiding lockdown
item.description: Schools, restaurants and hair salons across Sweden have remained open amid the Covid-19 pandemic, which has infected upwards of 3.2million people globally.

item.title: Jeff Bezos says Amazon could LOSE money this quarter
item.description: Amazon had earlier said it would hire about 175,000 workers and raise wages by $2 for hourly workers as well as overtime pay, which would increase expenses by nearly $700 million.

item.title: Former Secret Service agent is teaching the rest of us how to take on the world
item.description: Former U.S. Secret Service Agent Evy Poumpouras, has penned a memoir. The tome started with the idea of how to create inner strength and mental resilience.

item.title: Police watchdog orders inquiry into failure to investigate two fantasists who backed up Carl Beech
item.description: The pair, known as A and B, told 'deliberate lies' about a VIP Westminster paedophile ring in 2015, prolonging investigations. The Metropolitan Police ignored advice to investigate the serial liars.

item.title: Picasso in Grandma's shoe box and the story of one family's love and loss
item.description: Hadley Freeman reflects on the life of her paternal grandmother Sara Glass, in a fascinating new biography. Sara who was born in Paris, moved to New York with the imminent threat of war.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson's 'success' is 'woeful delusion'
item.description: PIERS MORGAN: Boris is back! And everything's going to be great! That was the emphatic message sent to the country today.

item.title: Peer's estate is slammed after criticising lockdown as 'saving the NHS, bankrupting everyone else'
item.description: A captioned picture of Somerleyton Hall near Lowestoft was removed after Facebook users criticised it for describing the lockdown as 'saving the NHS, bankrupting everyone else'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll 26,711; 674 new fatalities
item.description: NHS England declared 391 COVID-19 victims, while more were announced outside of hospitals and in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

item.title: Unspeakable truth of life as a eunuch
item.description: Laurence Dillon who had an orchidectomy for testicular cancer, explores the history of eunuchs around the world in a gripping memoir.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Random tests to keep reproduction rate under 1
item.description: The UK Government this afternoon confirmed that COVID-19 is now spreading slower than a one-to-one infection rate, meaning the virus should burn itself out.

item.title: Top Google AI expert attended Sage meeting of Government scientific advisers about coronavirus
item.description: Demis Hassabis, the founder and chief executive of the tech giant's DeepMind operation, sat in on a meeting of Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies (Sage).

item.title: Shocking moment Yodel driver lets himself into home of self-isolating family
item.description: The family, who live in Leeds, Yorkshire, is self isolating for 12 weeks because the six year old girl has asthma and is classified as high risk.

item.title: Tom Tugendhat targeted by 'sophisticated hacker' a week after branding China a 'tyranny'
item.description: Tom Tugendhat, chair of Britain's Foreign Affairs Select Committee, has been targeted by a 'pretty sophisticated hacker,' The vocal critic of the Chinese government warned followers today.

item.title: Alton Towers Smiler crash survivor Vicky Balch postpones wedding because of coronavirus
item.description: Alton Towers Smiler crash survivor Vicky Balch, 24, from Preston, Lancashire, was due to marry fiance Dino Manciocchi, 25, in Italy in September but has now had to postpone the wedding.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: The state-of-the-art protective face mask Premier League clubs are in talks to use
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY SAMI MOKBEL: As part of the Premier League's new guidelines ahead of their planned return to group training next month, players will be required to wear face masks.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Businesses reveal plans to get back to work
item.description: Ministers are working on a series of workplace guides going into 'granular detail' about the measures that will have to continue even when the lockdown is eased, which now looks like it will not be until June.

item.title: Woman wearing safety goggles AND glasses delivers flowers to No10 TWICE in one day
item.description: A diplomatic official from the High Commission for Pakistan delivered huge bouquets to 'Hon Mr Prime Mininster & Ms Symonds, 10 Downing Street' twice today - wearing double the PPE on her second visit.

item.title: Donald Trump laughs about UFO footage taken by Navy pilots and declassified by the Pentagon
item.description: The president spoke briefly about the footage to say 'that's a hell of a video' during an Oval Office interview.The footage has previously been acknowledged as real by the Navy.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Victoria Beckham REVERSES furlough decision
item.description: Victoria Beckham, pictured, has reversed a decision to seek a taxpayer bailout for her fashion firm by furloughing 30 staff which would have cost the taxpayer £150,000.

item.title: Germany gives the green light for museums, churches and zoos to reopen
item.description: Italian PM Giuseppe Conte bemoaned the 'rashness' of local politicians who opened up bars and pizzerias at a 'delicate stage' of the coronavirus crisis, four days before the lockdown is due to end.

item.title: Police have handed out 8,997 fines for lockdown breaches in last month
item.description: One so-called 'covidiot' has been given six fixed penalty notices in the past month after refusing to comply with the rules to stop the spread of the virus that has claimed 26,097 lives.

item.title: Boris Johnson reveals his joy at being with fiancee Carrie Symonds for the birth of their son
item.description: The Prime Minister, 55, spoke during his first public appearance since fiancee Carrie Symonds, 32, had a baby boy at a London NHS hospital yesterday morning.

item.title: Nearly two million pieces of microplastics per square metre found on seafloor
item.description: Ocean currents in the deep sea are creating microplastic hotspots which house around 1.9 million tiny pieces of debris per square metre, scientists have said.

item.title: The Sun has been 'unusually feeble' over the past 9,000 years
item.description: Astronomers from the Max Planck Institute in Germany compared the Sun to 369 similar stars and found it typically fluctuates five times weaker than them.

item.title: Melting ice sheets are responsible for a global sea level rise of 0.55 inches
item.description: Researchers at the University of Washington examined data from two space lasers that were able to make the most precise measurements of the ice sheets to date.

item.title: Father who started photographing toys as a hobby now makes a full-time living with industry giants
item.description: Mitchel Wu, 57, from LA, tells amazing stories in just single photographs, with the help of a whole host of familiar toys - from popular Disney and Lord of the Rings characters, to Hasbro's Power Rangers.

item.title: Boris Johnson announces huge spike in daily coronavirus tests to 81,000
item.description: Boris Johnson tonight announced a huge spike in the number of daily coronavirus tests to 81,000 as Matt Hancock appeared to be closing in on his 100,000 a day target.

item.title: People reveal the VERY literal ways of following instructions
item.description: Bored Panda users from around the world have compiled a list of the very literal instructions they have been given from friends and family including waiting at traffic lights meant for cars.

item.title: Colonel Tom Moore revealed he appeared on Blankety Blank aged 63
item.description: Colonel Tom Moore's incredible National Health Service fundraising attempt isn't his first brush with fame, as it's revealed he previously appeared on Blankety Blank.

item.title: Parents issue warning over fears children have mystery 'inflammatory syndrome' linked to coronavirus
item.description: Becky White from Bately, west Yorkshire, feared for Freddie after six weeks of the illness, reported Metro. Suzanne Mawdsley's children (left) in Greater Manchester had different symptoms, reported MEN.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: British Airways warns it could abandon Gatwick
item.description: British Airways has today told staff in a memo that it may cease to operate flights out of Gatwick airport in Crawley after the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: SAS hero reveals terrorist nearly let off grenade disguised as a hostage in Iranian embassy siege
item.description: Warrant Officer Ian White was one of the 32 commandos who famously stormed the building in London to bring an end to the six day hostage siege in 1980.

item.title: Man, 41, is arrested over murder of widower, 88, who was beaten to death in his Surrey home
item.description: A 41-year-old man has been arrested in connection with the murder of widower Dennis Kellond, 88, whose body was found at a home in the quiet Surrey village of Godstone this week.

item.title: Listed former Victorian courthouse and police station with its own cells goes on sale for £795,000
item.description: The Old Court in Clifton, Bristol, now has eight principal bedrooms and has been used as a guesthouse. It has not been used as a divisional magistrates court and police station for 60 years.

item.title: Matt Hancock faces MISSING 100,000-a-day testing target TODAY
item.description: Mr Hancock announced on April 2 he would achieve six-figure daily testing by close of play today but the latest numbers show 52,429 tests were carried out in the 24 hours to 9am yesterday.

item.title: Engineer, 54, spends 18 years and £15,000 building a RAILWAY to his hillside house
item.description: Allan Pyne, 54, lives with his wife Rachel in Dawlish, Devon, and has worked on the railways for more than 30 years. He has devised a track to ensure they do not have the difficulties of having to tackle steps.

item.title: Duncan Bannatyne escapes extended UK lockdown to jet back to his luxurious £3m Portuguese villa
item.description: The 71-year-old multi-millionaire flew on a private jet to his £3 million villa on the Algarve where he said he would spend 14 days in quarantine although restrictions will actually be lifted in three.

item.title: Earliest African slaves in Mexico were beaten, shot and riddled with disease, study finds
item.description: Three skeletons unearthed at a mass grave on the grounds of Hospital Real de San José de los Naturales, an early colonial period hospital in Mexico City were studied by scientists.

item.title: Chilling moment boyfriend calls police to confess to slitting his partner's throat in knife attack
item.description: Karl Molyneaux (left inset), 52, of South Shields, South Tyneside, fled his girlfriend's (right inset) house and CCTV shows him calling 999 at a petrol station (main). WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT.

item.title: People share their best fashion looks with the #MetGalaChallenge
item.description: People from all over the US are taking part in the #MetGalaChallenge, which was launched by Billy Porter and Vogue Magazine, encouraging people to recreate their favourite looks from home.

item.title: South Korea admits 292 coronavirus 'reinfections' were false positives
item.description: A clinical expert has now said the flurry of 'reinfected' COVID-19 patients in the past month was due to a testing fault. Dead viral fragments may remain in the body.

item.title: The ALTERNATIVE Premier League table: Manchester United miss out, Arsenal fall to 12th
item.description: As doubts grow about the viability of playing out the rest of the Premier League season, a number of methods have been mooted to complete the campaign. L'Equipe proposed their own.

item.title: Britain warns EU a post-Brexit trade deal is under threat unless it drops fishing demands
item.description: Officials blamed the EU for 'limited progress' so far in discussions over a free trade agreement, because of demands in areas including the resources in the waters around Britain.

item.title: Astronomers capture mesmerising images of planet-forming discs of dust and gas
item.description: An international team of astronomers used the Europe Southern Observatory Very Large Telescope in Chile to take 15 images of the inner rims of planetary discs.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 'Island communities' could leave lockdown first
item.description: The Cabinet Office Minister told MPs isolated areas where it is easy to control movement in and out could be used as test beds for measures that could then be used on a larger scale.

item.title: Jeremy Bamber's lawyers demand CPS hand over withheld papers disclosed to author behind ITV drama
item.description: Lawyers for the 59-year-old, who is serving life in prison for murdering his family in a gun massacre, will head to the high court tomorrow to fight for evidence they believe could help clear his name.

item.title: Mother-of-two reveals how she transformed her tired 1970s £467,500 house on a budget
item.description: Laura Deller, a 35-year-old teacher from Birmingham, told FEMAIL she bought the detached five bedroom property in Bedford for £467,500 with husband Chris in May last year.

item.title: Chinese food street famous for its 'insect feast' REOPENS
item.description: Vendors at the daily night market in Nanning, China, offer all sorts of cooked bugs, from spiders to silkworms, alongside various snacks, main dishes, fresh juices and desserts.

item.title: Wearing a 24lbs weighed vest all day can help obese people shed excess fat
item.description: Swedish researchers even think the novel weight-loss method could be more effective than some forms of physical exercise.

item.title: Dad makes impressive playhouse for his kids - and it cost just £150
item.description: Wayne Mulholland, 38, from Coventry, made a playhouse for his children using materials left over from building sites. In total, the impressive project cost just £150.

item.title: Meet the pig influencers with 15,000 Instagram followers
item.description: Amanda Zarabozo, from Wallingford, Connecticut, and her fiancé Charles Leiss share their bed with two pet pigs Lucy and Lily. And when the couple tie the knot, their pigs will have starring roles.
